Hi,

I'm doing some tests to see how easy it would be for us to upgrade to
=
JUnit4. Ideally the new runner should be able to run all of our
existing JU=
nit3.8 tests without modifications.

The Cookbook suggests to use
org.junit=
.runner.TextListener.run(TestClass1.class, ...) as
TestRunner; but looks li=
ke that bit of documentation is out of date.

Apparently JUnitCore is the c=
lass that does the job. In fact it works
very well with regular TestCases. =
But it doesn't seem to recognize
classes with a static Test suite() method.=
 E.g.

 $ java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore some.junit38.tests.StaticSuiteTes=
t
 JUnit version 4.1
 .E
 Time: 0.018
 There was 1 failure:
 1) warning(jun=
it.framework.TestSuite$1)
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests fo=
und in
some.junit38.tests.StaticSuiteTest

while with the old runner

 $ ja=
va junit.textui.TestRunner some.junit38.tests.StaticSuiteTest
 ..........
 =
Time: 0.004
 OK (10 tests)

If I annotate the legacy StaticSuiteTest with @=
RunWith(AllTests.class)
then the new runner is happy. But that means having=
 to find out all
classes using static suite() in our codebase, annotate and=
 recompile them.

Before delving into the new JUnit code, is this behaviour=
 expected?

Thanks

Mirko
